The claim is supported by a news article: which quotes the Legislative Study Group, a caucus of the Texas House, stating that Texas is "dead last in the number of residents over 25 who have a high school diploma."
The claim is verified by the American Co: a mail survey conducted by the U.S. Census Bureau, which shows that Texas ranks last among the states in the percentage of adults over 25 who have completed high school.
